Review Title: Nice looking and organized, clean approach
Review Description: I like the idea of the unconventional placement of the grinds holder sitting in the carafe. 1. This keeps the smell of grinds and any residue away from the reservoir and water flow, which by common sense would seem to keep these areas cleaner for a longer period. 2. Having to remove the grinds holder from the carafe to the external plastic holder - I don't see this as a burden, but a sensible option to contain the grinds until I am ready to dispose of them. 3. The overall design allows the reservoir itself to be easily cleaned, by simply wiping the excess water out with a clean, dry towel.The clicking sound is only a result of the machine having temporarily stopped the flow; it is not a defect. And the machine does beep when the brewing is finished.The iced coffee process works fine for me. The bottom plate warmer does not come on during iced brew mode.I only notice a slight difference in flavor when using the pour over mode, but it does take a little longer. Overall I don't feel that the Brewing process takes too long as others have stated. I do understand though that not having a timer to start a brew process for waking up in the morning could be a real negative for many.The coffee is hot - perfect in my opinion. And the warmer does keep the coffee hot.I typically do four cups by DeLonghi standards when I brew, which produces two standard mugs of java, or 20 ounces.Cons:1. The carafe is too large for the limited eighy cups that it is able to produce. This must play into the overall design, because it simply makes no sense. 2. The free flipping of the lid as you pour is a distraction and I could see it leading to a sloppy pour, though I have not experienced any spilling when I pour, but the lid overall feels abnormal compared to other lids.One positive I guess is that you don't have to touch the lid at all, because when you pour, the lid is designed to yield as the flow passes through to your cup - this is actually a clever design and I don't have a problem with it because it works. At the same time you can hold back the lid manually, but this has a different feel than other lids.3. I felt that the machine was expensive, so wait for a deal as I did.

Product Title: De'Longhi 3-in-1 Specialty Coffee Brewer, IcedCoffee Maker (Bold Cold Brew), Gourmet Pour Over, Premium Drip, SCA GoldenCup Certified, Glass Carafe, 8-Cup, ICM17270
Review Title: Very interesting and excellent coffee maker
Review Description: This is a Vine Program Product ReviewI snatched this coffee maker up because of one key feature it touts -- making pour over iced coffee without significantly watering it down.  I have been pleasantly surprised by the quality of the coffee the system makes.At first glance, you might look at the DeLonghi and think 'it's a coffee maker, big deal'.  I did at first.  It's a slightly different design on the basic drip coffee maker -- pour water into a reservoir, put grounds in a filter container and turn it on.  A few minutes later you have coffee in a nice glass carafe.On the surface, that's all true.  As a drip coffee maker it does what most drip coffee makers do and it does it quite well.  It isn't as compact a unit as many drip systems are that make as much or more coffee per max load, but due to the other primary function it serves -- an automatic pour over coffee maker -- that space on the counter is earned.Use of the 17270 is very simple -- Put an appropriate amount of water into the fixed position, top-placed reservoir, put a #4 cone filter into the carrier, put the appropriate amount of coffee grounds into the filter, put the carrier inside the carafe, put the carafe into the unit, and tell it to brew.  You have two options -- basic drip and pour over.The pour over mode supposedly uses a proprietary method of distributing the water around the grounds to produce a pour over experience.  I've not been swept up in the pour over phenomena myself, but to me there is a noticeable difference in the coffee produced by the drip and pour-over methods.  The pour-over seemed bolder, stronger and more flavorful (using the same beans for my tests to try and even out the playing field).  Either way produced a stronger cup than my Keurig normally does, but that isn't really a fair comparison to make because the coffee for the two machines is very different (I use a SF Bay Fog chaser pod in my Keurig that I absolutely love, here these were fresh ground beans).  So while I don't have a ton of experience with pour over, there was a definite difference in the strength and flavor between the two brewing methods.  Though it's not scientific, after my initial standard drip test, I've stuck to the pour over function for subsequent pots.Neither the standard drip nor the pour over was necessarily enough to move me to using this as my daily coffee method, however.  The final function likely is, though.I love iced coffee.  I spend quite a bit of time in the summer months cold brewing with a Toddy system to generally have a pitcher of cold-brew concentrate in my fridge I can always make a nice glass of iced coffee with, as it has always seemed silly to hot-brew coffee and then water it down by pouring it over ice immediately, and hot-brewed coffee has always made IMO an overly acidic cup of iced coffee, the flavor of which I don't particularly care for.The Delonghi takes an interesting approach to making iced coffee that I was very skeptical of at first, but the experiments have proven it out to me.  You put ice in the carafe, use less water than you normally would for a similar volume of coffee, and use the pour over setting to make the coffee.  While I was skeptical of the outcome, the results were excellent.What the system produced was a carafe of very bold, cold coffee.  To be clear, the coffee coming out of the carafe was cold, not lukewarm, which might seem obvious since it's being brewed directly onto ice, but there you have it.  Being poured over the ice didn't dilute it nearly as much as I'd feared, though I'm not 100% certain why.  Being cold, and still having ice cubes in the carafe, I didn't add any to my cup, just my normal amount of sweetening agent and creamer.  I was extremely surprised at how strong the coffee was and still flavorful, without the usual watering down I would have thought to happen had I taken hot coffee from a pot and poured it over ice (I happened to use some freshly ground Pikes Place 71 beans for this).  Without the extra ice I ordinarily might add, the watering down over the drink time wasn't present.The mid-afternoon pick me up from the initial cup out of the carafe was STRONG.  I normally wouldn't have gone back for the second full cup, but it tasted so good I did, and now I'm sure I will regret it tonight when I try to get some sleep :-).  This iced coffee experiment has likely earned it a spot on my counter.The unit also looks good sitting on the counter next to all the other family coffee paraphernalia, which doesn't hurt.One of the smaller 'attention to detail' items I find particularly awesome about the product is the inclusion of a little stand for the filter canister.  This little piece of the system was clearly thought out and demonstrates an understanding of how people do things.  The canister you put the filter and coffee into is conical since it sits right in the carafe for brewing, so when you take it out, there wouldn't be a place to put it; it can't really stand on its own as there is a covered nub on the bottom of it that controls the flow of coffee into the carafe during brewing.  Including a simple rectangular tray that the cone stands up perfectly in was simple genius.  Upon completion of brewing, you simply lift the canister out of the carafe with the attached lift handle, put it in the little plastic holder to cool, and you can pour your coffee without the used grounds and filter making a mess on the counter.  Super simple idea that massively improves the customer experience.This is one of those times I really wish for 1/2 stars in ratings because a product really needs to hit on all cylinders to earn 5 stars, and the one place this misses for me is in the initial out-of-box customer experience.  The instruction booklet is not well done at all.  In this minimalist era, it would be really nice if product documentation writers would all get together and refuse to skimp on instructions.  I mean, I realize this is a coffee maker not a rocket going to the moon, but they make such a big deal out of this being a 3 in 1 device, but the differentiation between the three modes and how to activate/use them is actually quite confusing due to the sparseness of the instructions but the constant reminder of how there are 3 modes throughout the document.  Maybe less words marketing the device I already have to me and more specifics on how to make it work?  You can figure it out, since again, it's a coffee maker not a rocket ship, but for all the attention to other details this one was a miss.

Product Title: De'Longhi 3-in-1 Specialty Coffee Brewer, IcedCoffee Maker (Bold Cold Brew), Gourmet Pour Over, Premium Drip, SCA GoldenCup Certified, Glass Carafe, 8-Cup, ICM17270
Review Title: Really Disappointed. But Makes Excellent Hot Water.
Review Description: My wife and I really love iced coffee, and all the drinks you can make with it, if you have a good machine that knows how to make good iced coffee. We were so excited about this being shipped and on it's way, we went out and bought all you need to make French Vanilla Iced Coffee, Iced Mocha, Iced White Chocolate Mocha, Carmel Flavored Iced Coffee, and ingredients for a few other favorite iced coffee drinks we like.  These all can be made at home with the right ingredients, and a machine that can make great tasting iced coffee.  The iced coffee is where it all starts, and if that's bad, sometimes there's not much hope for the finished drink.  Anyways, our Delonghi  3-in-1 Specialty Brewer arrived a few days ago, and being this machine is specially designed to make premium drip coffee, and iced coffee, we were expecting some great tasting cold coffee to make our favorite drinks from.  Even the product description states "Over ice for full-bodied Coffee - a first-of-its-kind over ice feature uses a proprietary process to brew smooth, full-bodied Coffee over ice so it’s never watered down", after reading that, I figured we were in for a treat, and excited about being able to make our own iced coffee drinks, and skip the $15 buck tab every time we head to the corner to our local coffee shop for something tasty, but expensive.  I've never used this machine before, but it's still a basic coffee machine, fill it with water, coffee in the filter, turn it on and wait.  We did that, and waited.  And waited, and waited, and waited some more.  We got nothing but boiling hot water in the top water reservoir, but it would never drip down through the filter and into the carafe.  I followed the guide to the letter (although the guide is as basic as you could get, any less, and there would be no guide).  The guide had no trouble shooting suggestions, so I found the Delonghi website, and got on a chat with customer service.  They couldn't help me so they gave me an 800 number to call.  I called, the guy was very friendly, gave me a few suggestions, and I figured the problem was about to be solved.  Got off the phone, tried his suggestions, and still, all we had was hot water.  I could have had hot water without a $150 coffee pot.  Now, 3-4 hours later, nothing to show for it, extremely frustrated, and looking at all the great tasting goodies we bought to add to our iced coffee just sitting there staring back at me, I surrendered.  I packed up our new, non functioning specialty drip and iced coffee brewer, put it in the corner where I didn't have to look at it, told my wife to grab her coat, and took her to our local coffee shop and treated her to anything she wanted.  I knew she was as disappointed as I was, and we sat there, enjoying drinks we should have been making at home, and wondered why our new Delonghi couldn't do the simplest of things, something coffee makers have been doing since someone invented a coffee maker, just drip water down into the filter.  I'm not positive, but I believe this drips the water down by simple gravity, nothing electronic forcing the water down, just falling, like rain drops, and totally dependent on gravity.  If this is how it works, and I'm assuming the force of gravity in my kitchen is the same as the rest of the world (we weren't floating around my kitchen like two astronauts that just lost gravity), we just couldn't get it.  So, overall, I hope you understand my 1 star rating.  We were not only extremely disappointed, but spent like $40 or $50 bucks buying ingredients for a multitude of different iced coffee drinks, and we still had to go to our corner coffee shop and spend another $20 bucks for iced coffee drinks.  But, the machine did make some darn good boiling hot water.  I figure we could use this for a fancy Ramen Noodle maker.  Our guests will be extremely impressed.  I have a feeling, by just dumb luck, we got a dud, and most likely the one in a thousand that wasn't working right.  I'll exchange it when I have time, and update this review when that happens.  Hopefully, at that time, I'll be telling you about the Iced Mocha I'm drinking, made from some great tasting iced coffee from my new Delonghi specialty brew machine.  Come back soon for the update!

Product Title: De'Longhi 3-in-1 Specialty Coffee Brewer, IcedCoffee Maker (Bold Cold Brew), Gourmet Pour Over, Premium Drip, SCA GoldenCup Certified, Glass Carafe, 8-Cup, ICM17270
Review Description: I've never used a pour over style coffee maker, but I do enjoy this machine.  The first thing I noticed about it was the sleek, modern look of the machine.  It looks great on the kitchen counter.You can use this coffee maker for traditional drip coffee or pour over coffee.  It uses #4 (cone shaped) filters and does come with five filters.  Making coffee is simple.  You fill the water reservoir with the amount of water needed, measure grounds into the filter/cup, place the cup inside the carafe, and press either the button for drip coffee or the button for pour over coffee.  Unlike a traditional drip machine, the coffee-making process does not start immediately.  The water in the reservoir is first heated to the boiling point.  Once the correct temperature is reached, the brewing process begins.  This ultimately means it does take a bit longer to complete the brewing cycle than a typical coffee maker.The finished coffee is very good.  Very hot, smooth, rich, and delicious.  I prefer the pour over setting as this seems to produce a fuller, smoother cup of coffee.  I have not tried to make iced coffee as I don't particularly care for it so can't comment on that function.I do like the included holder for the filter basket, which makes it easy to fill the filter with coffee and gives you a convenient place to store the basket after brewing.  The machine has an auto shut-off after one hour.  It beeps to let you know the brew cycle is beginning and it beeps again when the brew cycle ends.  It does not have a clock or timer for you to set up the machine at night and wake up to finished coffee, but I prefer to grind the beans right before brewing so this isn't an issue for me.The only part of this machine that gives me trouble is the cover for the water reservoir.  It's annoyingly difficult to get it to lock into place.  Since the machine will work even if the cover isn't actually in the locked position, why make it a locking sort of lid in the first place?  A flip-open cover would have been a simpler choice.Overall, great coffee from a nice looking, mostly easy to use machine.Edited to add:  Not long after writing this review, I accidentally broke the carafe.  I contacted DeLonghi customer support to ask about buying a replacement and learned the warranty covered a replacement carafe.  I provided my shipping address and received a new carafe within a couple of weeks.  Email replies from customer service were rather slow, but overall it was a good experience and I really appreciate that the warranty covered my own clumsiness.

Product Title: De'Longhi 3-in-1 Specialty Coffee Brewer, IcedCoffee Maker (Bold Cold Brew), Gourmet Pour Over, Premium Drip, SCA GoldenCup Certified, Glass Carafe, 8-Cup, ICM17270
Review Title: An easy, excellent cup of drip coffee!
Review Description: Clearly by my picture, I love coffee, and care about how I make it. I love the process, and enjoy the time spent. However, on some mornings I just don’t have the time.The De’Longhi is a lifesaver. It makes DELICIOUS coffee. It’s like a cross between a Chemex and V60.At approximately $150 it’s also a bargain compared to a Moccamaster, and to my palette, the coffee is just as good. In fact I use the moccamaster filters. The cup is better than my old Bonivata, and my breville grind control.The golden cup setting is perfect for most beans. But really light roasts should theoretically benefit from the longer pour over setting. However, I’ve found the prices setting brings out more roasty chocolates, and less fruit.Finally…  I typically use a ratio of 1:14, (10 grams per 140ml of water)  but they say .825:14. I tried my normal 10 grams per cup and the cup lacked clarity. They’re ratio works wonderfully. Clarity, depth, and flavor.So besides taste, why purchase this?1. Even though they sell it as a place to put the basket at the end, the included stand also makes dosing beans much easier, pleasurable even, and keeps the grinds out of the carafe.2. I’ve never been able to clean the boiler of a drip machine before. I love that I can keep it clean and dry after. Descaling will be a breeze! You can even measure the temp of the water if you wanted during the brewing process.3. It’s gorgeous!A few things it doesn’t do:1. Rinse your filter. You should do that and will greatly improve your coffee flavor.2. No automatic preinfusion. But, there’s workaround! There’s an auto stop feature. So, wait for the water to boil, then just as it starts to statuette the grounds, pull out the pot, open the lid, give it a swirl, and set your timer for 45 seconds. Then close it up, and put it back in to brew!Things I don’t like:1. A lot of plastic. I’m waiting for something to break… especially the small loop that, I think is needed for the pot to release water. But hopefully there’s replacement parts available.All in all:1. Delicious coffee with clarity, complexity, and cleanliness (but not too clean), and soft mouthfeel.2. Super easy to use and keep clean.3. A bargain compared to some other makers of similar brew quality.

Review Description: I love this coffee pot. Got this one after buying two different machines costing around the same price as this and they were terrible. The design of this coffee pot is unique and stylish. I love the fact that the water container is on top and clear. It's also easily accessible for cleaning. Most people don't realize that the water tanks on their conventional machines need cleaned regularly or bacteria will grow. The poor over brewing works better because the water is being poured over through multiple holes on the Carafes lid. Most generic machines only have one tiny hole which causes poor taste and accidents when the water fills up to fast spewing your grounds into your pot of fresh coffee. This machine has never given me any such issues and the grounds are brewed equally no dry spots . I also love the fact that you can't forget the coffee grounds in the machine over night causing that horrible mildew and mold. There is a stand for the coffee ground holder which makes filling it up very easy as my coffee grinder is constantly getting moved around the kitchen. This is honestly the best coffee I have ever been able to make. The water temp is controlled for a consistent brew every time. The ability to make Iced Coffee in just minutes is amazing. No waiting forever for the coffee to cool down in the fridge. No guessing on the amount of ice or water to use. This coffee machine will probably pay for itself in no time as it brews so efficiently I don't have to use as much beans for the same strength pot as usual. Also love the fact that this pot has a heating plate and that it actually stays on after the coffee is brewed! It also automatically shuts off. The certified brewing mode is the best! It's honestly the best coffee I have ever had at home. I will never buy starbucks again.

Product Title: De'Longhi 3-in-1 Specialty Coffee Brewer, IcedCoffee Maker (Bold Cold Brew), Gourmet Pour Over, Premium Drip, SCA GoldenCup Certified, Glass Carafe, 8-Cup, ICM17270
Review Title: A bit of a learning curve
Review Description: Once I figured out how to use this coffee maker, it worked fine. However, since this was the first coffee maker I had used, it was a bit difficult to figure things out at first. This was particularly true when attempting to make iced coffee. Making traditionally brewed coffee was relatively easy. The flavor produced was great and I could taste the difference between different coffee blends.If you are already familiar with coffee makers, you may have an easier time than I did. If this is your first go round, I might suggest something a little easier to navigate. I would probably give it 3.5 stars, but since half stars aren't an option, I went with four.

Product Title: De'Longhi 3-in-1 Specialty Coffee Brewer, IcedCoffee Maker (Bold Cold Brew), Gourmet Pour Over, Premium Drip, SCA GoldenCup Certified, Glass Carafe, 8-Cup, ICM17270
Review Title: A bit cumbersome, probably best suited for ice coffee
Review Description: This is a unique coffee maker with a cool transparent water reservoir and pour-over brewing. The carafe is extra large to accommodate ice for brewing ice coffee.The brewing process is relatively simple, fill up the filter with grounds and select a mode to begin brewing.The paper filters don't quite fit in the machine so you'll want to wet it as others have stated here to keep it from falling in on itself. I was surprised a premium device like this would be so clunky in its execution.Mode selection can be a bit confusing too. There are three modes but only two buttons. The first mode is the "SCA Golden Cup" which gets its own button. The second button is shared between iced coffee and the standard pour-over. To get the pour-over the button needs to be double tapped - otherwise it puts itself into iced mode. I'm not sure why they couldn't have just added a third button.Once turned on the water will be heated up to a boil. Once it reaches temperature a click can be heard and gravity will do its thing. You can begin pouring out a cup while it's still brewing (it'll stop dripping water into the carafe), but due to the design of the carafe it's very possible you'll end up pouring in some grinds along with the beverage. I recommend waiting for it to complete and remove the filter and its plastic mount before pouring.Coffee tastes great in all modes and I have no complaints there. But the design on this one could have been a little more polished given the premium price being asked.

Product Title: De'Longhi 3-in-1 Specialty Coffee Brewer, IcedCoffee Maker (Bold Cold Brew), Gourmet Pour Over, Premium Drip, SCA GoldenCup Certified, Glass Carafe, 8-Cup, ICM17270
Reviewer Name: A reader, a crafter, a gardener and cook
Review Title: great coffee but lacking features I love and need
Review Description: This makes a great cup of coffee but it's missing features that are important to me and I realize I want those features more than a better cup of coffee, so that's why I rated it low.I love the different ways you can brew coffee but I discovered that unless I see it brew, I can't discern a pour over versus a drip, my palate is just not that refined (or maybe I'm coming down with a cold, lol).I also LOVE how easy it is to add water. Seems like I've spent my whole life trying to pour water into little spaces in coffee pots and always missing.The hot plate stays warm for 1 hour then shuts off.What I'm not crazy about is that it can only make four cups at a time. The filter/coffee fits inside the carafe so if you add more water it covers the filter. Look closely at the picture they provide, it's showing you the level of coffee you can have before it touches the filter. Each of my mugs counts as more than one cup in ounces and when everyone wants coffee, or I have company, it simply does not make enough to fill all the cups. Iced coffee has to be made in quantities of 8 cups. Too much of it, too little of hot coffee. This annoys me no end.Next, because the filter cup is inside the carafe, you have to take it out before you can pour yourself a cup. They give you this little stand to put it on. This means no sneaking coffee before all is done and, what I hate even more, something else to clean.But here's what kills it for me...there is no programming to auto start in the morning. And it's "slow brewing" as in slow. Call me lazy but I love auto start in the morning, I love waking to the smell, I hate standing there watching this pot slow brew.So, the fact that it won't make more than a couple of cups and has no auto start kills it for me.

Product Title: De'Longhi 3-in-1 Specialty Coffee Brewer, IcedCoffee Maker (Bold Cold Brew), Gourmet Pour Over, Premium Drip, SCA GoldenCup Certified, Glass Carafe, 8-Cup, ICM17270
Review Description: The De'Longhi 3-in-1 Specialty Brewer is a unique coffee maker. I was interested in this because of the iced coffee feature. If you are an iced coffee drinker, you know it is tricky to get it right at home. I have to admit, I didn’t know what SCA Golden Cup meant. With a little research, I learned that it has to do with the coffee-to-water ratio in the prepared coffee. So, we were excited to try out these specialty brews, and we were not disappointed. This brews excellent coffee. It is easy to use for all three brew types; it is basically pushing a different button for the brew you want. For iced coffee, you add ice to the pot, and the heating element does not turn on. Since this is a drip brewer, a full pot takes approximately 12-minutes to brew. I like that the water reservoir is clear, and will be easy to keep clean. This is our second De'Longhi coffee maker, and we are very satisfied with the quality of their products, and the coffee.

Product Title: De'Longhi 3-in-1 Specialty Coffee Brewer, IcedCoffee Maker (Bold Cold Brew), Gourmet Pour Over, Premium Drip, SCA GoldenCup Certified, Glass Carafe, 8-Cup, ICM17270
Review Title: This makes great iced and pour-over coffee with an even, smooth flavor.
Review Description: This De'Longhi 3-in-1 Specialty Coffee Brewer ended up surprising me and I liked it more than I thought I would. I was a little worried about this coffee brewer, especially after reading some of the reviews on it. That said, for my purposes, it works well for me and makes a fresh and tasty cuppa each and every time.There are three ways you can brew coffee with this machine - pour over, over ice, and golden cup (drip style). I've never owned a pour over style coffee machine quite like this one, so this was a new experience. It really seems to brew everything I make consistently and evenly, bringing out the flavor nicely.I like the way this makes coffee over ice where it's not watered down - something I don't like. It brews it perfectly so that it doesn't taste weak or diluted - which is icky to me and a reason why I never preferred iced coffee - until now. I can drink iced coffee the way this brews it and actually enjoy it without making a face.I love the pulsing showerhead when using the pour over method, where it evenly disperses the water over the coffee grounds and gets all of it super saturated. This seems to really make a difference in the richness of flavor, since it's utilizing all of the coffee grounds really evenly, and I'm always happy at how smooth it tastes - yum! It's like having your own personal barista hanging out in your kitchen whenever you want!The warming plate stays on for around an hour or so after brewing, which is a nice feature like a normal coffee maker has. The carafe holds 8 cups, which is a nice quantity for my household. Most of the time, I am the only one in the house using this (although my husband uses it from time to time), so I don't need an industrial sized brewer.Overall, I haven't experienced any issues with this whatsoever, and I'm pretty pleased with its performance in how it makes my coffee taste. I like having a range of methods for brewing coffee to get my caffeine fix, so this is a really nice and useful addition for me. I've had this for about a month now with no problems, so I'm relatively happy overall with it. It gets two thumbs up from this household!

Product Title: De'Longhi 3-in-1 Specialty Coffee Brewer, IcedCoffee Maker (Bold Cold Brew), Gourmet Pour Over, Premium Drip, SCA GoldenCup Certified, Glass Carafe, 8-Cup, ICM17270
Review Title: Probably for a Specialized Audience (With Lots of Time)
Review Description: Here's the skinny.  Over the years, I've had about every kind of coffee pot there is, ranging from a French press, to a Mr. Coffee, to one of the ones that keeps the water super-heated and coffee only takes seconds to make fresh, to my current pot, a Keurig.  I was interested in trying this pot, as it's definitely a different design than I've tried in the past, but I also love some cold-brew coffee.This pot is not as intuitive at first as your basic coffee pot, and the instructions aren't quite as user-friendly and thorough as I would like.  Still, I managed and got  it going.I know this coffee was supposed to knock my socks off, and it was good - don't get me wrong.  But is it worth the price point, the sacrifice of counter space, and the time?  That, I'm not sure, or at least not for my life and lifestyle.  There are some days when I don't sit down for 10+ hours, and I need coffee, STAT.  I don't have time to wait.I think that if you're shopping for people who really have the time and luxury to sit down and savor coffee - vs pouring it down their throats to survive, as I do - then this is fantastic.  I do like the pot.  It just doesn't like my lifestyle!!

Product Title: De'Longhi 3-in-1 Specialty Coffee Brewer, IcedCoffee Maker (Bold Cold Brew), Gourmet Pour Over, Premium Drip, SCA GoldenCup Certified, Glass Carafe, 8-Cup, ICM17270
Review Title: Great for iced coffee. Uses #4 cone filter
Review Description:
The media could not be loaded.
                




   I have plenty of coffee machines but I got this because I wanted something to make ice coffee simple.  I also love De'Longhi and have found it to mean quality. I have owned their a/c units and heaters. They always seem to workout very easily and have a high tech yet simple approach to appliances.  They remind me of Dyson but actually work well.So i included the a video so that you can check out how the coffee is brewed into the ice. It doesn't pour over the ice, it instead fills up the ice. This makes it so that you don't water down the coffee as quickly and yet thoroughly chill your coffee. Its just an ingenues way of making iced coffee.I love the simple 2 button approach to making coffee. In reality you should only ever need 2 buttons. The left button turns on the machine. The right button starts the brewing process. After you press the right button, the boiler turns on and you can see your water bubble. After the correct temperature is reached, the machine lets the water pour over your grounded coffee. You can then see your coffee be released into your pot. This process usually takes about 30secs to a min to brew.

Product Title: De'Longhi 3-in-1 Specialty Coffee Brewer, IcedCoffee Maker (Bold Cold Brew), Gourmet Pour Over, Premium Drip, SCA GoldenCup Certified, Glass Carafe, 8-Cup, ICM17270
Review Description: This item was easy to use. The quality is good; the item is durable. I thought the proportions of the pitcher and the water reservoir were weird, but it makes since because of the amount of water you may need for your coffee. I plugged the item in and followed the directions in the booklet to make ice coffee. I poured 4 oz of water in the resevoir, then filled the pitcher with ice to the max line, then put 8 cups of ground coffee into the insert that goes inside the pitcher. Last, I pressed the over ice button for the item to start working. It took about 5-7 minutes for it to finish and the coffee was very strong. It did drip out little by little but I think that was to make sure the hot water that passed through the grounds didnt just melt the ice once it hit. Overall, very good product and works as advertised.

Product Title: De'Longhi 3-in-1 Specialty Coffee Brewer, IcedCoffee Maker (Bold Cold Brew), Gourmet Pour Over, Premium Drip, SCA GoldenCup Certified, Glass Carafe, 8-Cup, ICM17270
Review Title: No timer for automatic morning brew!
Review Description: This coffee pot is absolutely stunning, and will probably find itself a permanent place on a lot of counters, but not on mine!  I'm blown away to learn this coffee pot doesn't have an automatic timer, so I can't set up my coffee the night before to brew in the morning.  Unfortunately, I don't have the time or the patience to get up in the morning and brew coffee, so an automatic timer is an absolute must for me!As for flavor, it's a great coffee maker.  It's absolutely stunning, and does a great job making coffee.  I especially love the over ice coffee, it's very delicious.  The instruction manual could be better.  I also find it really confusing that the coffee maker has 3 settings but only 2 buttons... why not just add a 3rd button and spare us all the headache?If you want to make fancy coffee throughout the day, and don't care so much about an automatic timer, then this is a great pot for you.  Unfortunately, for me, I will probably only bring this out during the summer to make iced coffee, and then pack it away for the winter.

Product Title: De'Longhi 3-in-1 Specialty Coffee Brewer, IcedCoffee Maker (Bold Cold Brew), Gourmet Pour Over, Premium Drip, SCA GoldenCup Certified, Glass Carafe, 8-Cup, ICM17270
Review Title: I live at 2000 ft altitude - it only boils and never brews
Review Description: I live in Asheville, NC, which is at 2000 ft of elevation. Even at just THAT elevation this machine has a fundamental flaw and will not sense that the water is boiling, even if you see it at a RAGING boil - for each 500 ft in elevation, boil temp goes down 1 degree F. That means, my water boils at 4 degrees F lower than at 0 elevation. It's amazing that De'Longhi does not mention this and has not found a way to fix this issue. I'd avoid this product if you live at ANY elevation other than 0.

Product Title: De'Longhi 3-in-1 Specialty Coffee Brewer, IcedCoffee Maker (Bold Cold Brew), Gourmet Pour Over, Premium Drip, SCA GoldenCup Certified, Glass Carafe, 8-Cup, ICM17270
Review Title: Meh . . . too expensive; not much better than regular coffee
Review Description: I have a separate cold brew coffee maker and i like it better than this.  Granted, this makes 'iced coffee' as opposed to cold brew (according to snobs).  I don't really care how it makes the coffee, all I can say is that I prefer my cold brew jug better than this.However, if you don't care about taste, this thing is definitely faster.  My cold brew takes about a day to make (again, I do it according to instructions made by coffee snobs).  It's possible I can set the grounds in my current cold brew filter for an hour and get the same results, but I just stick to do what I'm told in the instructions.I'm not saying the taste is bad, but it is more difficult than either my traditional hot brew or cold brew maker and it doesn't taste as good.

Product Title: De'Longhi 3-in-1 Specialty Coffee Brewer, IcedCoffee Maker (Bold Cold Brew), Gourmet Pour Over, Premium Drip, SCA GoldenCup Certified, Glass Carafe, 8-Cup, ICM17270
Review Description: Do not buy this product.  I bought this through another retailer and the reviews of the machine being temperamental are true.  We do not live at a high elevation and had similar problems with the water boiling and not dripping into the carafe.  I had it for a month before it stopped working. I contacted De'Longhi's customer service who said the machine is very temperamental and they offered to send another one (along with the retailer) and I said no because why would I want another machine that will break in under a month.  If you can get it to work, the coffee tastes great.  I used the pour over version and my husband used the drip method. We experimented with the ice as well.  However, the cost per use isn't worth it.

Product Title: De'Longhi 3-in-1 Specialty Coffee Brewer, IcedCoffee Maker (Bold Cold Brew), Gourmet Pour Over, Premium Drip, SCA GoldenCup Certified, Glass Carafe, 8-Cup, ICM17270
Review Title: Does not work in high elevations
Review Description: Because water boils at a lower temp at high elevations, the water just boils and never opens up.  Originally used in Seattle, WA just fine, but when I moved to NW MT it stopped functioning properly.

Product Title: De'Longhi 3-in-1 Specialty Coffee Brewer, IcedCoffee Maker (Bold Cold Brew), Gourmet Pour Over, Premium Drip, SCA GoldenCup Certified, Glass Carafe, 8-Cup, ICM17270
Review Description: I am really excited about this cold brew coffee maker. It is perfect for gourmet pour overs, premium drip, and cold specialty brews. I love that I can make these at home and use specialty beans from Ethiopia, Colombia, and Sumatra.At the time of this review the retail price was around $150 which is reasonable for the quality.

Product Title: De'Longhi 3-in-1 Specialty Coffee Brewer, IcedCoffee Maker (Bold Cold Brew), Gourmet Pour Over, Premium Drip, SCA GoldenCup Certified, Glass Carafe, 8-Cup, ICM17270
Review Description: This is a spacesaver with it in an elongated design. It looks great but it just doesn't make enough coffee for my house and with the design it doesn't allow you to take it off while still brewing. It works fine and for someone that drinks small cups of coffee it is great.

Product Title: De'Longhi 3-in-1 Specialty Coffee Brewer, IcedCoffee Maker (Bold Cold Brew), Gourmet Pour Over, Premium Drip, SCA GoldenCup Certified, Glass Carafe, 8-Cup, ICM17270
Review Description: This coffee pot/brewer is such Hugh quality. It looks so fancy on my counter and it brewed coffee super easily. The manual makes it super easy to understand and the pot itself is super easy to navigate! I would definitely recommend this product!

Product Title: De'Longhi 3-in-1 Specialty Coffee Brewer, IcedCoffee Maker (Bold Cold Brew), Gourmet Pour Over, Premium Drip, SCA GoldenCup Certified, Glass Carafe, 8-Cup, ICM17270
Review Description: I think the coffee is terrific with this coffee maker. Finally, a hot cup. The top is slightly hard to get on correctly sometimes, Also, maker is a bit pricey. But still gets 5 stars from me.

Product Title: De'Longhi 3-in-1 Specialty Coffee Brewer, IcedCoffee Maker (Bold Cold Brew), Gourmet Pour Over, Premium Drip, SCA GoldenCup Certified, Glass Carafe, 8-Cup, ICM17270
Review Description: We’ve had the coffee maker for a week now and had some trial and error until we got the formula right.  It now is making great coffee, as good as our manual pour over method.  It certainly is a unique maker in that it works like having an electric hot water kettle and pour over setup in one machine.  The top reservoir heats all the water before a controlled release over the grounds using what appears to be a gravity system instead of a normal machines pumping technique.  The result is a great cup of coffee.My one complaint is that the plastic piece that holds the filter and coffee is too small for the #4 filter.  My first few attempts failed because the filter would collapse on itself causing the water to flow down the sides instead of over the coffee, making for very weak coffee.  We found if we first thoroughly wet the filter pressing it against the bottom and sides creating folds to make up for the larger filter the result was much more consistent.  This is why only 4 stars.

Product Title: De'Longhi 3-in-1 Specialty Coffee Brewer, IcedCoffee Maker (Bold Cold Brew), Gourmet Pour Over, Premium Drip, SCA GoldenCup Certified, Glass Carafe, 8-Cup, ICM17270
Review Title: This machine is great, if you let it be great
Review Description: The first thing I love about this coffee maker is that the coffee is awesome. Truly - just use their little scoop and good coffee and water. Whether it’s 6am or 4:20pm, the directions will show you the way.Another thing to love is that this coffee maker is also flexible. It makes great hot coffee, but equally bangin’ iced brew.I read a revIew that said it is a lousy single-cup brewer. Au contraire. I have found that making a quick 3-cup pot is just about perfect for my Yeti tumbler. A brewed “cup” is 4 ounces.I use a paper filter (size 4). I love that it’s paper and is compostable. Also, paper cones are believed to be healthier.My only negatives are that the top is kinda awkward sometimes and that I have to de-scale frequently.I do think it will be on my counter for many, many years, and in a world of coffee makers that promise to do everything but your taxes, this one executes a few simple functions flawlessly. That’s all I need it to do.  Buy it.  Cheers.

Product Title: De'Longhi 3-in-1 Specialty Coffee Brewer, IcedCoffee Maker (Bold Cold Brew), Gourmet Pour Over, Premium Drip, SCA GoldenCup Certified, Glass Carafe, 8-Cup, ICM17270
Review Title: Showed up and never worked ... now going to wait another week to get a replacement
Review Description: I can't really rate it ... it hasn't worked since it arrived. The unit just boils water and then shuts down. Creates a TON of steam (actually started to remove the lacquer on my cabinets it was putting out so much steam) and then shuts down. I've now been told it will be an estimated 5 days for the retailer to sort it out and potentially replace the unit. I wanted to like this coffee maker, but not at all impressed since it can't even pour the water (using gravity noless ... no pump, just needs to release the water from the warming chamber).

Product Title: De'Longhi 3-in-1 Specialty Coffee Brewer, IcedCoffee Maker (Bold Cold Brew), Gourmet Pour Over, Premium Drip, SCA GoldenCup Certified, Glass Carafe, 8-Cup, ICM17270
Review Description: According to their customer service, this coffee maker does not work at high altitude. I got one which just boiled water and never released it to the carafe. I received a replacement, and had the exact same problem. After a lengthy call with their support and a video chat to show them the issue, I was told that the machine will not work at my altitude. I live at about 5,200 ft which is not that high.I looked again at the product listing, and this pretty major issue is not disclosed anywhere. There are no sales restrictions to high altitude customers. Get this at low altitude and then move up high? Its going to stop working. Get this as a gift for a high altitude friend? Its not going to work. That is poor poor design. If you are one of the nearly 3 million people who live in the Denver area, you are out of luck. Same for Albuquerque, Santa Fe, Laramie, Flagtaff, Big Bear City, Evantson, Steamboat Springs, Durango, Gallup, Colorado Springs, Centennial, Montrose, Golden, Spring Creek, Lakewood, and countless other cities that are high elevation.No clue what the altitude cutoff is, but there should not be one

Product Title: De'Longhi 3-in-1 Specialty Coffee Brewer, IcedCoffee Maker (Bold Cold Brew), Gourmet Pour Over, Premium Drip, SCA GoldenCup Certified, Glass Carafe, 8-Cup, ICM17270
Review Description: This is certainly a distinctive looking unit being designed vertically and conserves counter space. The clear water reservoir offers a nice view of the boiling water before it drains to the grounds in the filter housing which fits into the pot. Note that the reservoir holds a maximum of 40 ounces of water for 8 x 5 oz cups of coffee (nobody I know drinks coffee in 5 oz cups, the smallest I use is 10 oz), because the filter sits inside the pot, the pot was designed to be pretty wide to avoid having the filter dipping into the coffee.Here's how my wife and I use the pot, 1) fill the filter with ground coffee 2) insert into the pot 3) return the pot to the base unit 4) fill the reservoir with filtered water 5) hit the brew button 6) ooo and ahh the first few times as you watch the water boil and drip into the pot 7) remove the filter unit to sit in the provided base 8) drink coffee 9) repeat if you want more than 2 cups of coffee (each), and we usually do.Overall, it is very pretty, it is De'Longhi (I do love their products) and it does drip, pour overs and iced coffee, the coffee it brews is everything I expect from a De'Longhi, but in the end I just can't get that excited about it.

Product Title: De'Longhi 3-in-1 Specialty Coffee Brewer, IcedCoffee Maker (Bold Cold Brew), Gourmet Pour Over, Premium Drip, SCA GoldenCup Certified, Glass Carafe, 8-Cup, ICM17270
Review Title: Simplistic and smart design, uses #4 cone filters
Review Description: We love this machine. In an era of complex coffee makers, the design is simple, refreshing, and elegant. It is easy to set up and after washing the carafe and running water through it to clean we were up and running.This coffee maker is fun to watch. The clear reservoir allows you to watch to the water as it heats to boiling and seeing the motion within the water as it heats is oddly relaxing. The design is simple and smart because the reservoir for the water contains the heating element. This means the entire machine is sterilized each time you make coffee, and there is no separate reservoir that you need to keep from getting gunky, which was always an annoyance with our previous machines.The coffee it makes is excellent, however to be honest we would not consider ourselves connoisseurs when it comes to different brewing methods - we just enjoy a good cup of coffee, which this delivers. We have some minor complaints, for instance the reservoir lid gets condensation from the water boiling which will drip down when you open the lid, however once you know it happens you can account for that when you open it. The other thing is we couldn't find anywhere in the manual where it said what size cone filter to use. We purchased #4 and it fit perfectly.Overall we love this machine - it delivers great coffee, is well designed, and stands out in a good way in the kitchen.

Product Title: De'Longhi 3-in-1 Specialty Coffee Brewer, IcedCoffee Maker (Bold Cold Brew), Gourmet Pour Over, Premium Drip, SCA GoldenCup Certified, Glass Carafe, 8-Cup, ICM17270
Review Description: This coffee machine is great for people who like ice coffee.  I live where it is hot almost year round, so in the summer months I oftentimes switch from hot coffee to iced coffee.  This coffee machine is well made, and designed for you to specifically brew iced coffee directly from the pot.  Instead of heating up the water it is brewed over ice so that you get a cold coffee without having to water it down significantly.If you like traditional coffee, this might not be the machine for you because it is a bit more complicated, but this works great for someone who specifically wants to drink iced coffee, and wants a coffee pot specifically designed for that purpose.

Product Title: De'Longhi 3-in-1 Specialty Coffee Brewer, IcedCoffee Maker (Bold Cold Brew), Gourmet Pour Over, Premium Drip, SCA GoldenCup Certified, Glass Carafe, 8-Cup, ICM17270
Review Description: Makes an amazing cup of coffee.  The flavor is smooth and perfect.  This is a great quality machine.  The iced coffee is wonderful as well.  Highly recommended.

Product Title: De'Longhi 3-in-1 Specialty Coffee Brewer, IcedCoffee Maker (Bold Cold Brew), Gourmet Pour Over, Premium Drip, SCA GoldenCup Certified, Glass Carafe, 8-Cup, ICM17270

Product Title: De'Longhi 3-in-1 Specialty Coffee Brewer, IcedCoffee Maker (Bold Cold Brew), Gourmet Pour Over, Premium Drip, SCA GoldenCup Certified, Glass Carafe, 8-Cup, ICM17270
Review Description: Pros and Cons:Pros:  The multi-functionality is convenient  Small footprint on the countertop  Easy to clean  Coffee turned out great relative to a cheaper machine  Simple controls  Aesthetically appealingCons:  Non-traditional cold-brew; doesn't suit my taste or expectations  Higher-elevation (used at ~650m/~2100ft) leads to occasional non-stop boiling  No reusable filter  Not designed for single cups of coffeeThe review:This coffee machine is very convenient considering the features it offers and the simplicity of operation. I can excuse most of the cons if not for the elevation issue; having a cup of coffee in the morning is, unfortunately, a coin flip when using this machine since the water occasionally boils endlessly.When it does brew successfully, the quality of the coffee is excellent. Although you don't have complete control over the pour-over process through temperature or timing options, the machine seems to handle it for you fairly well for a variety of grounds.Traditional cold brew coffee is steeped in water rather than done over ice using hot water and drip. It ends up being much stronger while still being very smooth; a unique flavor that isn't replicated here. It is, however, a fairly good approximation if you're in a pinch and don't want to steep grounds in the fridge for 24 hours. Since it manages to be a good middle-ground on account of its proprietary process, I'd consider it to be an overall positive feature.Overall, I would've happily given this product a full 4 or 5 stars if the coffee maker worked consistently

Product Title: De'Longhi 3-in-1 Specialty Coffee Brewer, IcedCoffee Maker (Bold Cold Brew), Gourmet Pour Over, Premium Drip, SCA GoldenCup Certified, Glass Carafe, 8-Cup, ICM17270
Review Description: I love the innovative concept as it’s designed to brew great-tasting iced coffee as well as SCA-certified excellent drip coffee. As I love Tim Hortons and McDonald's iced caps, I was extremely eager to try the iced coffee feature of this 3-in-1 specialty coffee maker.It does your basic drip-style coffees but you also have the option to do your own pour-over coffee if you so desire (although I don’t get the point…) but it’s the over-ice option that stands out to me. The only downside is that you can’t make single cups of iced coffee at a time but to me, that’s not a major problem since I’m never satisfied with just one serving of iced coffee. Any extra can be frozen or kept in the fridge for later!The whole machine is about 13” high but it has a relatively small footprint. It doesn’t take up much more space when compared to my basic drip coffee maker. With the brewing water above the glass coffee carafe in an hourglass design, the coffee grounds basket actually fits inside the opening of the glass carafe and you have to remove it before pouring your coffee. There’s a basket holder included to keep it from dripping everywhere on your counter but it’s an unusual design and takes some getting used to. It’s not as convenient in my opinion.The main problem with this machine is that it’s a troublesome coffeemaker. It literally won’t work in high altitude regions and that’s not mentioned anywhere in the product description or on the packaging itself. Something like “suitable for at sea level or a maximum elevation of x,000ft only“. Seems to me that such a limitation should be cause for a disclaimer somewhere on the box or listed in the specifications so people don’t waste their time buying something that won’t work because of where they live.PROS+ Makes flavorful and rich tasting coffee in 3 different ways (drip, pour-over, or iced)+ Makes about 8 cups of coffee at a time+ Keeps coffee warm for one hour before auto-shutoff kicks inCONS- Won’t work at higher elevations.- Takes longer to brew (~11 minutes)- Glass carafe is not very thick. It seems very fragile so you must be very cautious when cleaning or moving it.- I don’t love the in-carafe basket design.- Doesn’t come with a permanent filter. I haven’t had to buy paper filters in years!- No programmable features. Can’t set a timer to wake up to freshly brewed coffee in the morning

Product Title: De'Longhi 3-in-1 Specialty Coffee Brewer, IcedCoffee Maker (Bold Cold Brew), Gourmet Pour Over, Premium Drip, SCA GoldenCup Certified, Glass Carafe, 8-Cup, ICM17270
Review Description: I was really looking forward to getting this and making iced coffee a regular part of the average day, it was not meant to be.Over a number of weeks I tried dozens of times but the machine did not work right. The water would boil inside the top reservoir but simply did not drop. Whatever mechanism is supposed to release the water didn't work. I did the usual things, pushed the buttons, looked at the manual, made sure the carafe was placed such that the trigger button (located on the arm that hold the top and bottom sections together) but nothing worked.I tried calling support and in all, over 6 calls I spent more than 10 hours on hold waiting for help. I tried one last time and in 10 minutes got through to a rep who immediately once I explained what was happening asked me where I lived, he looked up the elevation and stated that the machine would not work as we are at too high of an elevation! I would expect them to list this important information so that before ordering a user could look up and see it the machine was going to work where they live. Canada is made up places where people live that are at sea level to over 9000 foot elevations.He offered to send out a different model of coffee maker in exchange. All I had to do was email them a picture off the power cord being cut at the coffee maker. The replacement is a machine that can also be used to make iced coffee.Ok so I got the new machine, set it up and grrrrr... no water flowing. This machine has a simple user interface for setting the time and that sport of thing. Part of its functions is setting the altitude, which I did but still no water. After playing with it for 20 minutes, adjusting the altitude setting - from 1 to 5 and trying the cleaning function as well as just making coffee it suddenly worked. It sounded like the pump was trying to work but it was air locked (an air bubble can get trapped in a pump and cause it to stop moving water) and with all the messing around it must have cleared the bubble.So I got a machine that does iced coffee but what a hassle.♦ ♦ I give zero stars for the coffee machine.♦ ♦ I have to give no more than three points total considering how long I had to sit on hold waiting for someone to talk to.♦ ♦ While the new machine does work it was a hassle to get going and I cant give stars to the model shown here when what I finally got was a different machine.So there it is, a 3-star review simply because they did send a replacement machine. They stood behind their product but they clearly need to hire more CSR people.

Product Title: De'Longhi 3-in-1 Specialty Coffee Brewer, IcedCoffee Maker (Bold Cold Brew), Gourmet Pour Over, Premium Drip, SCA GoldenCup Certified, Glass Carafe, 8-Cup, ICM17270
Review Description: I normally love DeLonghi. They make legitimately awesome espresso makers. Apart from the Vine program, I've talked 2 people into buying their $250 range models because they're completely worth it. Unfortunately, the ICM17270 3 in 1 brewer is SUCH a disappointment.It doesn't matter how good this machine looks, it will not brew. I hate 1 star reviews that complain due to receiving a lemon, but this seems like an unadvertised design flaw. Several users report that the machine will BOIL their water endlessly and never proceed to the brewing cycle. This is exactly what's happening to me. I followed the initial cycle steps, and it hasn't worked. I also followed another user's recommendation of initiating the pour over brew cycle, which also won't work.Upon further investigation, I found a user who suspects it is due to living at elevation. I live in Calgary, so I live at elevation. Okay, so one random user had this problem. That can't be it, right? I searched around the interwebs and found a user from a competitor review site who had the same problem. He called into customer service; they elevated the call to a manager who literally asked him, "Do you live at elevation?" Then they had the user ship it back because IT DOESN'T WORK AT ELEVATION.I'm sorry. I didn't see that advertised by DeLonghi, and I don't see that in the fine print. I now officially have a $180 paperweight sitting on my desk. If DeLonghi comments on this review, I'll happily return it... but I'm not happy to have wasted my time having to write this.UPDATE 12/3/2020:2 months ago, De'Longhi got back to me in the comments below this review.Here's what's happened so far.De'Longhi customer service called me (which I missed due to work). They left a message saying they intended to give me a replacement unit, and they said they'd call back. I e-mailed giving a list of times that were convenient for me and were well within De'Longhi's working hours... they still didn't get back to me. I sent another e-mail. Still no call. I then called twice; once, I was hung up on while waiting for 30 minutes. The next time, I waited 15 minutes and gave up.Unfortunately, there's been no resolution to this issue, so I'm still sitting on a paperweight. I literally want to send it back; I'd really rather not get rid of the unit.

Product Title: De'Longhi 3-in-1 Specialty Coffee Brewer, IcedCoffee Maker (Bold Cold Brew), Gourmet Pour Over, Premium Drip, SCA GoldenCup Certified, Glass Carafe, 8-Cup, ICM17270
Review Description: The De'Longhi ICM17270 allows you to make three different types of coffee in a very, very simple machine. With the press of a button you can make drip or pour-over coffee or you can make some very refreshing iced coffee. The machine only has two buttons for these three types of coffee. There is no customization, no timer, nothing you can adjust. It's just press and go.The water reservoir is located on the top of the machine and the grounds holder sits inside the oversized carafe. This coffee maker has a bigger than average footprint, coming in at about 13" high and 12" wide (include handle of carafe).I find this machine to be quite noisy. It continually clicks on and off (this is due to the machine stopping the water flow while it brings the water back up to temperature as it brews). I'm also not overly keen on the ground/filter holder being inside the carafe. It is a strange design that leads to a very large carafe and a lot of wasted space in my opinion.All of these minor annoyances aside (did I mention the buttons are right next to the hot plate? I hope your eyes are fully opened when you make your first cup in the morning), this machine really does brew a nice cup or three of coffee. To my uncultured taste buds, the drip and pour-over taste essentially the same, but at least you have the option for either one. The iced coffee is also really nice, and I love that is so simple to make given that you brew the coffee right onto the ice cubes.I didn't have any issues with the water flowing from the tank into the carafe. Be sure that the carafe is full inserted into the machine and touching the button at the back as this is what turns off the safety feature.If you are looking for super simple 8-cup machine that also makes iced coffee, this is a great option for you.

Product Title: De'Longhi 3-in-1 Specialty Coffee Brewer, IcedCoffee Maker (Bold Cold Brew), Gourmet Pour Over, Premium Drip, SCA GoldenCup Certified, Glass Carafe, 8-Cup, ICM17270
Review Description: At first, I wasn’t sure how to even operate this type of coffee maker. It looks a little different than the coffee makers we all grew up with. The included quick start guide makes getting your first cup of coffee brewing very simple. I got mine running within 10 minutes of opening the box. The water compartment is see-through and is on top. You can see the water bubble and come to a boil. The water is heated in that container and then makes its way over the coffee grounds and finally into the carafe. The 3-in-1 means that it can make ice-coffee, it can make drip coffee, and it can do pour over.It has the SCA gold sticker which means your water will be the exact right temperature to get the most out of your coffee beans. The carafe where your coffee eventually ends up in is located below the water container and the coffee grounds bin fits right into it. The grounds bin is designed so that when its removed from the carafe, the valve below it shuts. One of the accessories provided is a carrier for the grounds bin so when you take it out, you don’t have to just place it on the counter and make a mess – a very well thought out accessory to include. Other accessories included are a scoop, samples of the number 4 paper coffee filter.At the very bottom of the unit, there is also a heating plate that keeps your coffee warm as it’s being made. Near it are controls to turn it on/ off. When making iced coffee, you’ll want it off. When making drip or pour-over coffee, you’ll want it on.It has a safety feature that shuts off the valve from the water container to the carafe when the carafe is removed so you won’t accidentally have hot water being poured over your counter-top.Some of the downsides I found are as follows. The buttons are not the highest quality. It also makes very loud beeping sounds that’s not appropriate for an environment that needs to stay quiet.Some of the upsides I noticed are the sleek design. It fits right in with a modern kitchen with gray, black, and white tones. It looks modern with the sleek glass surfaced and curves designed into its hour-glass shape.Overall, if like me, you find yourself buying a lot of iced-coffee from Tim Hortons over the summer, I think this a worthwhile investment for your kitchen. It works well and there’s not much to complain about.

Product Title: De'Longhi 3-in-1 Specialty Coffee Brewer, IcedCoffee Maker (Bold Cold Brew), Gourmet Pour Over, Premium Drip, SCA GoldenCup Certified, Glass Carafe, 8-Cup, ICM17270
Review Description: This is a really neat 3-in-1 Specialty Coffee Brewer from DeLonghi that features an automated pulsing brew cycle and a shower head for perfectly even extraction. It has three different methods for preparing your coffee: premium drip style, pour over method using the carafe or brew over ice. I found that it produces good (not great) hot coffee but the iced coffee is the best I have ever had from an at home machine. It takes into account the amount of water that is produced from the ice so your coffee doesn’t taste watered down or weak. It also automatically turns off the heating plate so that the ice doesn’t melt. I am a huge iced coffee lover so this has been a big game changer for me, especially during Covid.The water tank holds 42 ounces and makes about 8 cups of coffee. It has a 60 minute keep warm option so your coffee stays hot while you get ready in the morning. It also features an automatic 1 hour shut off so you don’t have to second guess if you turned it off after you leave the house.The biggest issue I have with this machine is how long it takes to make a coffee. It heats up for about 5 minutes and then takes another 7 minutes or so to brew a full pot. This isn’t ideal if you have a busy lifestyle and unfortunately, it doesn’t have a timer so you can’t have a pot ready to go. I really don’t like that you have to use paper filters each time and I think it should come with a reusable filter instead. I also wish that you could buy a replacement carafe incase this one happens to break. It is made from glass and I am nervous that a bump from a mug or countertop could break it and then the machine would be useless without it.

Product Title: De'Longhi 3-in-1 Specialty Coffee Brewer, IcedCoffee Maker (Bold Cold Brew), Gourmet Pour Over, Premium Drip, SCA GoldenCup Certified, Glass Carafe, 8-Cup, ICM17270
Review Description: I got this for my teen sons to use as they are fans of ice coffee and will often brew coffee and store it in the fridge and then add ice cubes when it was cold enough. I thought the design of this coffee maker looked cool and since it was 3-in-1 they could use it for themselves for hot or cold coffee.The design of it is what drew me in. I find it stunning. It is different and takes up somewhat less space. I'm not a fan of paper filters though and wish they would have had a reusable stainless steel filter for the price.As for hot coffee, I find it okay. No different than a regular drip machine. I do find that the pour over tastes better. So if you are buying it for this reason. Save your money because you can get the same or better features at about half the price or more like time setting and programming. I like my coffee really strong and I found that it was a struggle to get a good, strong cup. I have to use a lot of coffee. I've been spoiled with automatic brewers which select that for me, so for me the hot coffee didn't win me over. My sons like regular coffee and were fine with it.As for iced coffee, it was pretty good and the best cold brewer I have tried yet since the others will melt the ice a lot more and water it down. This actually takes into account the amount of water to put in with the ice so that you get a good full flavoured brew and the heating plate is off to reduce the melting.  I would recommend medium to large sized cubes so that you don't have the hot coffee that is pouring out to melt small ones and overly large ones makes it hard to pour a cup without making a mess. You can also pour the coffee on the iced coffee setting without ice, then add some cold cream or milk to it (even better if you have a frother that froths cold milk)  and/or then add in a blender with ice and make your own iced cappuccino. Add in some coffee syrup for a custom flavour.So, the star of the show here seems to be the brew over ice feature. So if you are looking for that and also a way to serve up a cup of coffee and aren't too picky about it, then this would be a good buy. For someone who is very picky about their coffee, you might find this too pricey and lacking in features to be worth it.

Product Title: De'Longhi 3-in-1 Specialty Coffee Brewer, IcedCoffee Maker (Bold Cold Brew), Gourmet Pour Over, Premium Drip, SCA GoldenCup Certified, Glass Carafe, 8-Cup, ICM17270
Review Description: I'm torn on how to review this premium coffee maker by De'Longhi. One one hand it really does brew a fabulous cup of coffee. The flavour is rich and smooth and my husband and I both really enjoy this. I enjoy iced coffee and will often make a special trip to buy it at an out-of-the-way coffee shop where I live, but I tried brewing a cup using this machine and was very pleased with the flavour as well as how bold it turned out.On the other hand I'm not sure that I would pay the full asking price of $199.99 for this coffee maker. We have a less expensive one that has more features. This maker does not have a timer that you can set ahead of time to make busy mornings better nor does it do as much as I would expect for a "premium" maker. Yes, the design is interesting, and it doesn't take up much room on my kitchen counter, but the price tag seems overly steep in my opinion.This is a premium coffee maker and you get what you pay for; you are paying for a great-tasting coffee. In this case that is all that you are paying for- you are not paying for the bells and whistles that other coffee makers usually come with. If you are very particular about the flavour of your coffee this may be worth investing in but if not there are less expensive models out there that come with more features.

Product Title: De'Longhi 3-in-1 Specialty Coffee Brewer, IcedCoffee Maker (Bold Cold Brew), Gourmet Pour Over, Premium Drip, SCA GoldenCup Certified, Glass Carafe, 8-Cup, ICM17270
Review Description: A machine that can do regular coffee (brewed in two different ways) plus iced coffee is very convenient for those who like both types. Having the choice between iced coffee, drip-style coffee, or a pour-over cup of coffee is also great when you have guests over who might want their coffee done in a different way.The actual machine itself is smaller than I expected. It’s barely a foot tall and takes up very little counter space in my kitchen. I think the main reason this is smaller than I expected is because it stores and boils the water on top of the machine, so you don’t have a separate water container on the back or side taking up extra room.You do need to use paper filters with this coffee maker, which I’m personally not a fan of. I would much prefer a reusable filter that you simply wash each time, but if you want to you can just buy one yourself that fits the right size. I am happy to see that there’s an auto-shutoff feature, both to avoid burning the coffee and also as an energy-saving measure.The quick-start guide that is included is very simple to understand, with lots of pictures and clear descriptions. It walks you through everything you need to know, including how to make coffee in the three different ways in case you’ve never made some of them before. I found it very helpful for making iced coffee the first time. I found the coffee made in this machine was good, but obviously that’s heavily influenced by the kinds of grounds you use. I thought the coffee was great, but it also depends on what coffee you use and other elements.One issue I do have with this coffee maker is that it’s really not designed for speed or for single cups of coffee. The measurements on the carafe begin at 2 cups, and it takes up to 10 minutes to finish making the first batch of coffee in the morning. This isn’t a long time, but if you’re in a rush or on the way to work it can feel like a very long time to be waiting for your coffee. On top of that, if you want to make coffee in the morning it’s annoying not to have an option for a single cup of coffee, as anything else is going to be wasted unless someone else in your house will drink it.Overall, I think this coffee maker is a compact and convenient machine for most people, with my only real complaints being that it isn’t very fast and it isn’t ideal for making a single cup of coffee in the morning. For multiple people, or for the office, it’s easy to make coffee in three different ways and can even make iced coffee.

Product Title: De'Longhi 3-in-1 Specialty Coffee Brewer, IcedCoffee Maker (Bold Cold Brew), Gourmet Pour Over, Premium Drip, SCA GoldenCup Certified, Glass Carafe, 8-Cup, ICM17270
Review Description: [PROS] 👍✔  Fresh Quality Coffee✔ Easy to Clean & Operate✔ 3 Brewing Functionalities[CONS] 👎✘ Paper Filter Required✘ Long Preparation Time✘ Buttons are Mediocre[PRODUCT EXPERIENCE]➔ The De'Longhi 3-1 Specialist Coffee Brewer arrived well packed and the instructions are well explained; after cleaning the machine, set-up took just a few minutes on my kitchen counter. You are given the opportunity to use 3 different functionalities to make coffee - 1) drip style, 2) using the carafe to pour into a cup, 3) brew over ice …my favourite is the 3rd option. In the last 2 weeks of testing, I found every cup of coffee to be exceptional in taste and experienced no issues with the coffee machine itself. In-fact, it is super easy to clean and operate, something that I always expect with the De'Longhi brand, given my positive experience over the years.➔ Moreover, you will be required to purchase the paper filters; I would have liked to see a reusable filter that you can rinse in the sink rather than relying on paper filters. In addition, the prep time in the morning can reach a good 10 minutes before your cup is ready - this may not be a big deal to some people however, for me I am accustomed to getting a coffee cup in 1 minute from my automated espresso machine. And finally, I found the buttons to be mediocre/cheap.[FINAL THOUGHTS] ★ ★ ★ ★👉 Overall, I have had a positive experience of consistent coffee drinking over 2 weeks with no major issues besides the minor inconveniences listed above. I plan on using this machine every day - especially during summer months as I absolutely adore a cold cup of ice coffee anytime of the day. You will not be disappointed.

Product Title: De'Longhi 3-in-1 Specialty Coffee Brewer, IcedCoffee Maker (Bold Cold Brew), Gourmet Pour Over, Premium Drip, SCA GoldenCup Certified, Glass Carafe, 8-Cup, ICM17270
Review Description: I really like the sleek look of this machine. It is eye-catching and unique. It makes good drip coffee and it also does pour-over and iced coffee. It comes with a filter stand, a scoop, some extra filters. It uses number 4 filters. I like how I can see the water boiling when its ready to start dripping. It does have some quirky things about its functionality that don’t really win me over. There is no timer on this machine. It takes time to heat up and if you’re like me and rushing around in the morning, a timer is key. The filter basket is inside the carafe. To some this would be okay, but I don’t love it. The basket does have a valve on it though, which closes when you lift if from the carafe so it doesn’t drip everywhere. It comes with a little tray to hold it when you’re not using it. I find it a bit awkward if you’re making a cold brew and you’re fiddling with ice and trying to fit the basket on top. It just becomes annoying. The heat plate is easy to shut off for cold brew and it also has an automatic shut off so you don’t scald your coffee. There is a button that gets pushed when the carafe is in place, and it stops the flow of water when the carafe is removed. In most machines this is a great feature because you can sneak a quick cup of coffee while its brewing, but the filter is in the way and it just doesn’t work for a quick cup. I like that there are only two buttons on this machine. It is really user friendly. Overall, there are good things and not-so-good things about this machine. I love the look of it, the coffee tastes great and its easy to work. The placement of the filter basket and absence of timer is just not great for me.

Product Title: De'Longhi 3-in-1 Specialty Coffee Brewer, IcedCoffee Maker (Bold Cold Brew), Gourmet Pour Over, Premium Drip, SCA GoldenCup Certified, Glass Carafe, 8-Cup, ICM17270
Review Description: I'll start with the positive.The Delonghi 3in1 has a small footprint and is minimalistic. I like that. If you don't need a timer or lots of functions this is a great choice if you can get past the price tag.It made a really good drip coffee.Now for the bad:Companies are always trying to find a way to make you pay for a cold coffee with unnecessarily complicated and expensive equipment.A real cold brew coffee doesn't need to drip and won't use hot water. Been drinking cold brew and iced coffees for as long as I can remember. You can buy a container for maybe 30 dollars here on amazon where you simply pour in your coarsely ground coffee in the inner tube surrounded by a mesh (kinda like a french press concept), fill up the container with water and leave it in the fridge for up to 24 hours. You get some of the best tasting cold brew like that. No heat. Try it.  The flavor profile is incredible. You're extracting flavor at cold temp over many hours. There's less caffeine but the flavor is so much smoother. But I digress.With the Delonghi you have to fill the carafe  with ice cubes (up to the indicated spot) and then your hot coffee drips onto the ice cubes and cools down. The result was not bad at all, but definitely not worth paying that much money for it. It's awkward having to fill the carafe with ice cubes then placing the filter with coffee back on.Oh yes, one of the drawbacks to such a simple and elegant looking coffee maker is that the filter basket sits on top of the carafe so when you want to pour a cup you must not forget to remove the basket and place it on the included basket stand.All in all, it makes good coffee, so I can't give it a bad rating, but it is not the cold brew you want, nor is it worth shelling out that kind of money for it.

Product Title: De'Longhi 3-in-1 Specialty Coffee Brewer, IcedCoffee Maker (Bold Cold Brew), Gourmet Pour Over, Premium Drip, SCA GoldenCup Certified, Glass Carafe, 8-Cup, ICM17270
Review Description: This is a very strange coffee maker. The build quality for the most part is excellent, has a small footprint, and looks great on my counter. The only criticism I have about the design is the buttons. They are just a bit... off. They feel cheap for the price and are in an odd place. More of a concern though is the lack of a feature I would consider to be mandatory at this price. That feature being a timer to start brewing. This coffee maker is far from fast. Having a timer to start this brewing 10 minutes before I come downstairs to my kitchen would make my morning go a little quicker.One thing you can't complain about is the quality. I mainly use this for hot coffee and the pot comes out piping hot and flavorful every time. It is excellent. I did also play around with cold brewing as well and it seemed to work quite well. I am not a huge fan of cold brews myself, but nobody else in the house had any complaints and enjoyed it.Overall, this is a good coffee maker. The only thing keeping it from being perfect are those buttons and the lack of a timer. Both could have been solved and should have been solved at this price. You can buy $40 coffee makers that have a timer, after all.

Product Title: De'Longhi 3-in-1 Specialty Coffee Brewer, IcedCoffee Maker (Bold Cold Brew), Gourmet Pour Over, Premium Drip, SCA GoldenCup Certified, Glass Carafe, 8-Cup, ICM17270
Review Description: I really like my iced coffee and had purchased a different solution for my cold brew fix awhile ago... but this one is infinitely more versatile as it can also make traditional drip coffee in a pinch. I absolutely love the concept and I'm a sucker for consolidating kitchen appliances.So how was it? Well, simply put, I didn't find the coffee over ice to be anything special despite the SCA certification. Sure, the coffee tasted good, but I really didn't find it warranted buying a machine compared to just double brewing and dumping the result in ice. Maybe I offended the coffee gods by saying that, but to me, I don't feel like I can really taste enough of an improvement to justify this machine for this.As for how it performs as a regular coffee maker? Honestly, I found the cup of coffee to be about the same as the Braun Multiserve and the cool design of this one doesn't really make an impact outside of visuals. Technically, the pulsing showerhead is supposed to taste better... but I just didn't feel like it made all that much of a difference.At the end of the day, there's nothing wrong with the machine but at almost $200, I think the Multiserve is a much more compelling product at a very similar price.

Product Title: De'Longhi 3-in-1 Specialty Coffee Brewer, IcedCoffee Maker (Bold Cold Brew), Gourmet Pour Over, Premium Drip, SCA GoldenCup Certified, Glass Carafe, 8-Cup, ICM17270
Review Description: The most appealing part about this coffee maker to my wife and I was the fact that we could make iced coffee at home without having to leave the house. It is a very nice looking coffee maker, and is thin enough to slide alongside our other counter top appliances.We tried the iced coffee mode first and were pleasantly surprised with the results.
